alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 14 at 4:47PM EST by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by heavy rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Broward. * WHEN...Until 645 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in vulnerable, low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 446 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to heavy rainshowers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in some spots, with up to an inch more broadly across the area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Hollywood, Coral Springs, Pompano Beach, Davie, Plantation, Sunrise, Deerfield Beach, Tamarac, Margate, Lauderhill, Coconut Creek, Oakland Park, North Lauderdale, Lauderdale Lakes, Dania Beach, Cooper City, Parkland, Broadview-Pompano Park and Village Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
